summary: Email exchange between U.S. Department of Justice personnel regarding coordination for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, specifically mentioning interest in Prince Andrew. A U.S. prosecutor requests a call with a DOJ attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London to discuss logistical questions.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of news in the UK regarding FBI/DOJ interest. His role in the context is as a figure of investigative interest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the ongoing investigation being worked on by the team of prosecutors.

events.title: DOJ Coordination Request Regarding Epstein Investigation
events.description: A team of U.S. prosecutors working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation reaches out to a DOJ attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London to schedule a call to discuss logistical questions related to the investigation, which includes interest in Prince Andrew.

locations: United States Embassy, 33 Nine Elms Lane, London SW11 7US, United Kingdom
Southern District of New York (implied as prosecutor's office)
keyFacts: The document is an email exchange dated December 3, 2019, concerning the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
U.S. prosecutors state there has been 'quite a bit of news in the UK about FBI/DOJ interest in Prince Andrew.'
The prosecutors, from the Southern District of New York, are seeking logistical coordination with a DOJ attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London.
The communication indicates active U.S. investigative interest in Prince Andrew in late 2019.
